title: Drawing, 1788
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash and watercolor on two sheets of white laid paper,  laid down on blue paper with added border of blue paper.
inscribed: At lower right, in black ink: PIAN TERRENO  T I; at lower left, scale (in Venetian feet).
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Ground plan of the theatre: horse-shoe shaped space and entry at bottom; exterior spaces (canal?) indicated in green.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash and watercolor on two sheets of white laid paper,  laid down on blue paper with added border of blue paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-117.
